storyInfo: Blue Poison and Glaucus investigate an abandoned building to the north of Iberia and meet Indigo, who found her way to the building while she was lost. She tells them what this building once was—a lighthouse.

attributes.content: 2:18 P.M. \ Clear
Deserted Coastal Town, North of Iberia
We've arrived at the specified coordinates.
The target building's outside appearance matches the description outlined in the preliminary survey report.
Our team will now proceed into the building for an inspection. We may need to cut the transmission. Watch for flares, in case anything happens.
Blue Poison, over and out.
There's an entrance here. Hm, it doesn't look like the builders intended for this to be here.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: The edges are pretty rough, like it was hacked open with an axe. Perhaps the bounty hunters did this? I heard some of them like to come 'treasure hunting' here.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: That's probably because they aren't Iberians...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Right, ruins like this one are more than 'toxic' to those who got out of that alive.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: As for the ones that stayed behind... The Church, the Inquisition... They have no way to make it here.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: They already pay too high a price, and they wouldn't want to see any of this.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: It's just like how I never wanted to look at my legs when I was a kid. No matter how much I tried, they just couldn't run. Iberia as it is now doesn't want to see any of these broken parts.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Look at you, using yourself as an analogy again. I'm starting to feel bad.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Hm, I can tell you are joking this time.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Electromagnetic Pulse Field released.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: So, should we go up? Or down?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Your call.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: I'm thinking up. I'm not entirely sure why, but I feel up is the way to go. This place is like... a tower.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: A tower? How tall do you think it is? The part that stands above ground is at most three stories. What could its purpose be?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: In that case, I guess we should go down.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: You just reminded me that we have no idea how far down it might go.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Let's find out, then. And don't worry. I got your back.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: That puts my mind at ease, though I do hope we won't end up in a fight.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Hm, it's dark in here.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: The lighting system is busted.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: You can't fix it?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: The Iberian technology here is several decades old. Their wiring is nothing like Raythean's. If you gave me a few days...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Don't worry about it, then. We'll let Closure and Engineering worry about it later. We won't be staying in this coffin pit for long.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Coffin?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: It's an analogy, or maybe not. There is a foul stench lingering in this building.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: It's been abandoned for years, and then it was flooded with seawater and buried by mud...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Shh.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Say, if we don't talk, do you suppose we'll hear ghosts screaming?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: G-Ghosts...?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Oh, it's just a joke. Try not to tug so hard on my clothes. I like this new outfit a lot.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Oh... We should switch on our portable Originium lamps.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Now it's much brighter.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: You seem to be a big fan of these technological ruins.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: This kind of technology only existed in the coastal towns of the past. You don't see them much in Iberia these days.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: What... are they for?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: For observation? To relay signals? Or could it be... for sightseeing?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Perhaps it was for locking people up.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Possibly...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: When we look at the Iberia of the past, we some see the technology that they left behind, like gold covered in dust.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Yet, during those radiant times, there were countless bones buried underneath El Dorado.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: I'm sorry...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: What are you apologizing for? The bones of the Ægirs who took my ancestors away to Iberia have long been eroded by the sea waves.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: I don't hate Iberia, nor do I hate the Ægir people. Now, I suppose I don't even hate myself as much anymore. This is all thanks to the Doctor and you, Glau.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Does this technology... give you any bad memories?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: All I care about is whether this place will be of any use to Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: In the end, this is what we are here for, no?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Right... We're here to scout out the surroundings, to analyze the data, and to confirm what we can retrieve.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Too bad that this place has been torn apart inside and out, though. If it was just the time and the environment, the parts wouldn't be this wrecked.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Look at this part here. It went so far... Ah!
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: What's wrong? Why did you pull out your Franker all of a sudden...?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: T-There's a ghost!
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: A ghost...? You mean the shadow in the path ahead?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: It isn't moving. Doesn't seem to be alive.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Judging from his getup... It seems he was a bounty hunter.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: We haven't made it very far from the entrance. Perhaps he was the one who cracked it open, and he died here after he came inside.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Oh, I see.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Wait, let's not get any closer yet.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: We still don't know how he died.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: You think it could be dangerous?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: A bounty hunter died so close to the entrance.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: We'll have to watch out for whatever killed him.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Stand back a little more.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: I can smell... the scent of the seawater.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Seawater? We're pretty far away from the shore.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: You don't mean...
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Though Blue Poison told Glaucus to stay where she is, she continues to walk toward the corpse. She kneels down about a meter away, observing it closely.
Okay, it's just some seagrass.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: It's a full skeleton. No sign that he was eaten by any monsters, and there are no other fatal injuries.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: *Sniffs*
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: No trace of any common toxins that could lead to death either.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Judging from his posture, he likely got himself tied up in the seagrass and drowned.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: I don't see any water, though. It's dry everywhere.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Take a closer look at the rust left on the wall.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Hm... I can see some areas are more rusted than others.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: So this place was flooded twice, then?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: The seawater destroyed the building the first time around. Whatever its function was, that was when it failed. The second time, the seawater gushed into this place again, flooding its insides once more.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: And this poor bastard happened to be in here at the time. He likely thought he'd hit the jackpot, and was happily tearing away at the things in the wall.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: He didn't manage to escape in time when the seawater began to flood the building, and the seagrass had his arms and legs caught. He lost his life after struggling for a while.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: You can't really blame him. He was a Kuranta.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Poor guy... They don't know the strength of the sea.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: The Doctor once mentioned that research on the ocean is for the most part done only by a handful of oceanologists. It's not a very popular field.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Well, it's not really that strange. We are only interested in the things that we can see and conquer.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Perhaps... the Iberia of the past was the sole exception.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: It's all in the past. I haven't seen the ocean myself either.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Hm... I'm not even sure why you're so sensitive to the scent of seawater.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Have you heard that rumor?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: About the disasters?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: We... don't talk about that. That's not allowed in Iberia.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: You're all used to avoiding the subject.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: It's hard to kick your habits. We don't talk much about... our homeland at Rhodes Island. Besides, each of us has a different impression of that incident, and sometimes even about that whole area.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: I've talked to Weedy about it. Both of us are Ægirs who grew up in Iberia, and I've come to realize the Iberia in her eyes is totally different from the one I see.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: That's nothing strange, no? If you are not allowed to discuss the incident, then the only thing you will remember of it is the small fragment that you saw with your own eyes.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: They... are taking the chance to piece the fragments together, from the people.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Hm, there's only the two of us now. I could talk about it, but... I'm afraid to do that. It's like something has my throat blocked.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: I'm worried that as soon as I talk, the shadows cast on the path here will charge toward me.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: And I say that even though I know it's just shadows cast by the Originium lamp.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Shadows... What a fine analogy. They skillfully redirect everyone's attention away, such that they fear the shadows rather than the enormous truth that lies behind.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: It's so cold... but I'm sweating.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: In the past, I would never even imagine that I could stand here and talk to you about this.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Everyone feels that way.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: I suppose this pitch-black, sealed-off building is protecting us.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: There's a dead body here, and we don't know what lies ahead. But this keeps me even more at ease than a wide open space.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: The walls here give us a false sense of security, a sense that everything's under our control.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: You're right. At least there isn't another pair of eyes staring at us.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Now I'm not sure about that.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Stop trying to scare me...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Okay, okay. I'll stop. Back to the topic of the disaster. The Inquisition isn't actually to blame for that decision. The decision to not talk about that was made by the Ægirs who came ashore.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: I guess it was a form of self protection.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Self... protection?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Do you know why the Ægirs came ashore?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: I... don't know. I thought we were meant to be here to begin with, though it seems most Iberians don't agree with that.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: I'm not too familiar either.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Yeah... but you know more than we do, at the very least.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: It's funny. The history slowly disappeared from the Ægirs' memories, and we are the ones who still remember any of it.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: My ancestors were taken away by the Ægirs some hundred years ago. They wanted the 'toxic' ability that we are born with.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Why... is that?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: They kept extracting the toxins for experiments. They were trying to figure out whether these subterranean toxins could be used as some kind of weapon...
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: What were they trying to attack with that?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: I have no idea. How could I have seen it? From my elders tell me, it was an enormous, terrifying monster that doesn't exist on land.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: It's from the sea...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: All I can say is that's extraordinarily likely.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: I thought about asking the Doctor or Dr. Kal'tsit... or even the hunters directly.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Once, I happened upon Operator Skadi. This question immediately rose to the top of my mind.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: I doubt she'd tell you...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Right, I don't think so either, and I didn't ask her in the end.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: I'm not sure I have the courage to find out the truth...
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Just like the Ægirs who came ashore, it took them several hundred years to forget that fear. That's how they could finally put down roots with their minds at ease to slowly become a part of Iberia.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: No one would cast aside a new life they earned for themselves to fight what could be an endless war. Especially not when nobody knows when that disaster would actually strike, and when it actually strikes, everything could still be futile.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Even I wish that I could live a new life, even after the Doctor has taught me so much.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: In that case... perhaps we should turn back, then?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: We can still make it.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Perhaps.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: You're still going straight ahead...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Oh, you're right. I'm still going straight.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Thinking back, after all these years, I haven't once thought of giving up my abilities to use my toxin.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Perhaps I've never managed to break free of the souls of those Ægirs who enslaved my ancestors, and, deep down in my heart, I believe that the toxins in me will get the enemies they're meant for.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: How far down have we come?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: I lost track.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Me too.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: This tower is deeper than I expected... Uh, taller. The confined space here is disrupting our senses.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Oh, I think I'm hallucinating.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: What did you see?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: (Blinks)
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: A light up ahead.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: And it's slowly floating upwards.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: (Quietly) Switch your light off!
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Amid the darkness, there is a white light swaying not far away.
Blue Poison makes sure this isn't a reflection of their lamps. Is it an illusion, or is it real? Which scenario is more dangerous?
(Let's get closer. Slowly now, don't surprise them.)
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: (Is it a threat?)
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: (Prepare for combat...)
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: (Franker at the ready.)
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: (Okay, we'll be making contact soon. There's a corner up ahead. Watch my hand. I'll knock three times. On the count of three—)
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: A bolt whizzes through the air.
It strikes the fuzzy white light. No, not quite. Just as it was about to strike the object, its trajectory curved to the side.
It's no problem. No one can see it. The bolt split in two soon after it was shot, one in the front, and one in the back, capturing the white light.
The very next moment, the white light suddenly expands.
Franker, maximum power!
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: W-Wait!
Amplifying microwave—
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: I mean no harm!
Hm?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: *Cough*... Oww... hit my back... what a shockwave...
Please don't do that again...
If it's mercy you want, you should stop casting, Caster.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Uh, you mean my light? N-No, you're mistaken. This is just for lighting up my surroundings.
I defended myself on reflex. Please believe me! I don't want to hurt you at all!
No wonder... it feels kind of warm... and bright... Nothing about it makes me feel sick.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Glau, don't let your guard down just yet.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Her Originium Arts are not to be underestimated. This seems a little special, even.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: P-Put it down, please! Could you also move your bolt away from my neck...? Just a little, please?
I... I'm too scared to even breathe now... *Whimpers*...
I can lower my crossbow.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: But you need to drop your staff too. If you try anything funny, believe me, your reflexes are no match for my bolts.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Okay...
The light extinguishes as soon as the girl throws her staff away.
Originium lamp.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: So that light was yours...
Are you after us?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: No, that isn't what I meant.
I was waiting down below. There's no one else here, and when I saw your light, I thought maybe somebody decided to check this place out, so I started climbing the stairs to meet this guest.
You said you've been here for a while. Who are you?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Oh, I forgot to introduce myself... Um, my name is Aria.
Well, Aria, are you an Iberian?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Yes. Why, is it obvious?
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: I figured I'd ask. If you'd said no, I would've guessed Columbian or Victorian. I have my ways to make you talk.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Why, that's sending chills down my spine...
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: You're an Iberian and a Caster, and your Originium Arts work as a light. Are you affiliated with the Inquisition?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: The Inquisition? No, no, no! I haven't ever met them.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: What are you doing here, then?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: (Isn't this almost an interrogation? We're just here to check this place out.)
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: (It's more efficient to ask her directly. Besides, it doesn't seem like she noticed anything's off yet.)
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Mmm... What am I doing here again?
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Why, I'm not actually so sure myself...
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Hm? Do you have amnesia, perhaps?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: No, of course not. I remember how I got here and that I spent the last couple days here.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Two days ago, I asked a local about any opportunities to make some money in the area. I needed work... Otherwise I would go hungry.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: He took the last few coins I had and told me I could come seek riches here.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: (Sounds like she ran into a con man...)
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: He might've mistaken you for a bounty hunter.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: A lot of bounty hunters used to come to this area in the past. You have a staff, and you, well... you look like you are from a rather well off family, by your appearance. They may have thought you an aristocratic young lady looking for adventure.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Oh... Is that it? So they misunderstood me...
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: (They probably didn't... They could tell right away what a gullible girl you are.)
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: (Smiles)
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: I-Is that funny?
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: No, my friend here may be a little shy around strangers, but she seems to be worried about you.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: *Cough*...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Huh? W-Why, thanks! It's okay. I'm just lost, and since I saw a lighthouse here, I thought I'd come rest in here a little...
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: I-I was lost, yes...
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: No, that isn't what I was asking. You said this used to be a lighthouse?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Oh, yes. You can find lighthouses everywhere in Iberia. Have you never seen one before?
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Hm... Perhaps they're only seen along the coastline. I've been away for about half a year now, and the towns farther from the coast don't have lighthouses.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Did you grow up by the sea?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Yes, and not far away from here. It's a small town, so you probably haven't heard of it.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: How is it doing...?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Okay... I guess?
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: There aren't that many people, so we all got along well. My teacher said we were lucky. The sea's disasters spared our home.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Phew... That's great.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Well... except our lighthouse. Ever since that day, our lighthouse has never lit up again.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Since that day?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Right, that one day several decades ago. The day when disaster struck.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: In that one brief moment, the entire Iberian coastline was shrouded in darkness.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Ever since... it's never lit up again.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Aria, you seem rather familiar with lighthouses.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Why, that's because I grew up in one.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: In a lighthouse like this...?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Please don't get the wrong idea. My town's lighthouse is in much better condition. There wasn't a lot of damage, it just won't light up anymore.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: The mechanical parts, the central control system, the power circuits, the automation core, the outside wall Hologram emitter, and the wireless communications were all fine.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: My teacher would take me around the lighthouse every day to inspect and maintain everything, according to the manual. We even repaired the outside walls regularly.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Why, I can confidently say that, aside from the aging materials, our lighthouse is in just as great a condition as it was decades ago.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: That's amazing...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Your eyes light up when you're talking about your lighthouse... Just like when I talk to anyone else about Franker.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Do you and your teacher manage lighthouses?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Oh, I'm sorry if I forgot to mention. Yes, my teacher is a glorious lighthouse keeper.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: As for me... I'm afraid I'm not there yet... A lighthouse only needs one official keeper, and I, uh, I'm just an apprentice...
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: And it's been so long since I left... so I guess I'm not even an apprentice anymore. *Sigh*...
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: You left long ago, but you still remember all the steps like the back of your hand.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: That's because I recite them before bed every night!
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: You really love your job, Aria.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: I want to see the scenery my teacher described to me. It was something her teacher had described to her too.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Under the night sky, a multitude of intersecting courses in the sea lit up by the lighthouse.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: All the grand drilling rigs and sea forts glimmering in the dark as ships large and small come and go in their surroundings... It was far more bustling than any city on land and far more radiant than even when the sun burned its brightest...
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: If you got close enough, you could even see the underwater cities that the Iberian Ægirs built along the continental shelf.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: All of this was possible thanks to the thousands of lighthouses that stood on the Iberian coastline.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Now, disaster struck our energy system. None of the lighthouses can ever light up again as they once did.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Yet my teacher and I stayed to tend to the lighthouse.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Every night, my teacher would try to light it. The signal lamp doesn't work, so we made a new light source.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Our light source may not be able to stand in for a real lighthouse and illuminate the whole sea around us, only a small corner.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: And ships may long have stopped sailing the sea—
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: But we are still here.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: And you'll be there to watch the lighthouse even if the coast will remain forever silent?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Yes, we will.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: This is the top of the lighthouse.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: I inspected it a couple days ago. The lighthouse is in a really bad shape... There was hardly anything left of it before.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: This is the only thing still here.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: What is it...?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: It's a kind of energy core that Iberian lighthouses use. The most advanced technology they use... and also the first to be destroyed.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Is it broken?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: The original technology was lost... Neither I nor my teacher could restore its design. Without the complete energy system, we don't have a way to use the core to its full potential.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Perhaps... Hm... If you don't mind, I would like to take this back to Rhodes Island and inspect it with Closure.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Oh... I'm not saying I have a good grasp of this... Iberian technologies from those days have some really special wiring... Just like this core. All I can tell is that it's not based around Originium technology.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: It doesn't use Originium as its energy source?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Not quite. It most likely still uses Originium for its energy, but... the foundation of the technology is very different. I'm even thinking that perhaps Originium energy isn't the best power source for this device.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Oh!
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: W-What's the matter? Is what I am talking about too boring...?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Can you really light up the lighthouse again?
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: I think it's worth a try. It may take a while.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: I... I think I want to come with you.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Does that Rhodes Island you two are talking about need people like me? I don't know much... but... I'll work as hard as I can.
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: First, you need a resume.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: What's a resume? I...
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Mm... Weird... Why, I'm feeling kind of dizzy...
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: She passed out. What's the matter?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: (Shrugs)
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Oh... did she get poisoned?
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Here I was thinking that Phidia is immune to my toxins, like you are.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Though it looks like it just took longer for it to affect her.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: (How should I say this? Perhaps her body isn't special in anyway. She's just... a little slow?)
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: (Let's not analyze this right now. D-Do you have an antidote? You're out on a mission with me alone, so you got to have one, right...?)
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Relax. The paralysis is temporary.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Let's head outside. She should come around after she gets a little breeze.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Disable EMP field.
attributes.name: Glaucus

attributes.content: Finally! How are you, ladies? Have you run into any trouble?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Only a brief interlude...
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: *Cough*...
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Oh, you're finally awake?
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Sorry, it seems like I fell asleep...
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: You came back around sooner than I expected.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: No need to worry. Our investigation was a success.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: So why can I hear a third person? Sounds like a young lady with whom I've not had the pleasure...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: We met her at the mission location. Her name is Aria, and she gave us some valuable information. She'll be coming with us to Rhodes Island to hand PR her resume.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Ah, well, let me welcome you in advance!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: H-Hello...
attributes.name: Aria

attributes.content: Right, in conclusion, this was a lighthouse.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Hm? A lighthouse? Did I hear that right? Our informant said it was 'really complicated by the looks.'
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: (I thought it was some important facility...)
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: It was built before that disaster in Iberia.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: I get it now...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: The inner structure is still pretty intact, though the related technologies suffered heavy damage. We don't know for sure how much we can retrieve from here.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: And let the engineering team following this up know—
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: This place has the potential to become a new Rhodes Island office.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: Okay...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: *Sigh*... If this actually ends up becoming a new office, I will probably have to run back and forth all the time, won't I?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: And it's so close to that place too...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Well, I guess we don't exactly have much choice. We aren't the only ones that need this, either. The informant said there's been some refugees who escaped the destroyed towns to the south. They have a tough journey ahead, and they'll need someone to look out for them.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Right. Perhaps this lighthouse... will end up being fairly useful.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: We can provide medical services for the Infected in the area and help those in need, and we can... watch the tides that draw towards the land closer and closer day after day.
attributes.name: Blue Poison

attributes.content: It may not shine upon the area anymore... but it can still watch over this coastline.
attributes.name: Blue Poison
